resources.string: This will reset most crdroid settings to their default values for the current user. Would you like to continue?
Press on color below to apply
View changes in the ROM installed
Check out if #crDroidAndroid is available for your device @ https://crdroid.net/
We love open source, check us out
We are on telegram. Join us!
Get notified of new builds on Telegram
Help with localisation of ROM in your language!
We recommend their servers if interested in one
Donate to support server hosting, site uptime and overall management

Answer incoming calls by pressing the volume buttons

Unlock automatically if you input a correct PIN. This is slightly less secure than tapping Enter to confirm.

Must be in DateFormat eg. MM/dd/yy

Full → empty: red ← green ← blue ← red
Full → empty: red → green → blue → red
Display clock in quick status bar header
Display date in quick status bar header
Display estimated remaining battery life when available
Display and customize current network traffic levels
Hide the traffic monitor when inactive
Duration after which speed is remeasured
Hide the network traffic indicator arrows
Display an alert at bottom of QS panel when network is monitored by external apps or VPN

Each bar is animated more smoothly
Display navigation bar at bottom of screen
Display left and right cursor buttons while typing. Overrides IME switcher.
Inverts the layout of the navigation bar and other items, such as the IME switcher

Enabling this will disable hardware keys for navigation

resources.string: Hide QS on secure lock screen

Please select an action to perform
Select what happens when you use Quick Tap. You can change this later in settings.
Let’s try that once more. Quickly tap the back of your phone twice.
You’re ready to start using Quick Tap
Quickly tap the back of your phone twice.
To change the tap strength needed to use Quick Tap, go to Settings.
You‘ve just tapped twice on the back of your device, which allows you to use your Assistant on the go. You can customize this gesture in settings.
Take a screenshot, show notifications, or start another action in two taps.
Please select an app to open
Select the app you’d like to open when you use Quick Tap.
Tap back of phone twice to
Select an app to open when you tap the back of your phone twice. If you uninstall the app, Quick Tap turns off until you select a different app.
Select what happens when you open this app using Quick Tap.
Show Game Dashboard shortcut in games
Only get notified by important people and apps when playing a game

Smart pixels is a power saving feature. Depending on how many pixels you decide to turn off, you could see improvement in battery life. Note that in some cases it can result in unresponsive areas on touch screen
Save battery by shutting off extra pixels
Shut off pixels to reduce power consumption
Enable Smart Pixels when battery saver is enabled
Prevents burn-in on OLED devices by shifting pixels every so often
Replace clear all notification text with material style floating button
Show an animated arrow for back gesture
Vibrate when performing a back gesture
Set opacity level for QS background
Display data usage summary in quick settings footer
Play sound when screenshot is taken
Show label below icon instead next to icon
QS rows should be equal or greater than QQS rows. Use higher number of columns for circle / square (A11) QS tile style.
Setup icon pack and weather service
Requires weather service to be enabled
Pause media when volume is muted and resume it by increasing volume within the timeout
Automatically pauses media when the volume is muted and will resume automatically when volume is restored within the set time
Display a custom logo on left or right of the status bar
Show an overlay in the left bottom corner of the screen when something is copied to the clipboard

Significant motion, accelerometer, linear acceleration sensors will be blocked for these apps
Replaces the default pattern only\nApp set pattern takes precedence

Determine if the device can connect to the internet, by contacting Google. Also used to detect captive portals.

Allow running multiple instances of the same application in parallel
Display WiFi standard next to WiFi signal
Control Google services and core apps

Before disabling Google services and core apps, you should disable "Find My Device" and 2-step verification on your Google account. It is strongly recommended to keep this setting enabled else apps dependent on Google components will be affected. If you run into any issues after changing this setting, perform a factory reset.
Do not display next available shortcut if chosen shortcut is not available
Select the apps to protect with biometrics or device credentials
Duration of time after which an unlocked app in background should be locked
Notification content will be hidden and collapsed for selected apps when they are locked. Heads up notifications will be automatically disabled.
Bubbles will be automatically dismissed after timeout
Prevent this application from showing up in any launcher. Requires a launcher restart for changes to take effect.
For better visibility on bright images
Select an image to use for static mode
You must install a gallery app!
Display heads-up notification in Dynamic Island style
Display currently playing song in Dynamic Island style

The Island notification feature, inspired by iOS's Dynamic Island, transforms Android's heads-up notifications into quick-access and compact notification utility.

Island Quick Access Controls includes the following features:
1. Tap island notification to quick answer phone calls.
2. Long press island notification to reject phone calls.
3. Long press island notification to expand the island notification preview.
Use dual tone background colors instead of AOSP single tone
Control the granularity of each stream
Set schedule for always on display
Turns on from sunset till a time
Turns on from a time till sunrise

Show bluetooth dialog or toggle bluetooth state on tapping bluetooth tile
